title: How do you manage cloud-native data security across hybrid environments?

content:
Managing cloud-native data security in a hybrid environment involves coordinating data protection strategies across public clouds, private clouds, and on-premises data centers. Its importance lies in ensuring data consistency, confidentiality, and compliance across cloud-native applications (such as microservices), addressing regulatory requirements like GDPR or HIPAA, and supporting business continuity in modern hybrid IT architectures.

Core components include unified identity and access management (IAM), end-to-end encryption (at rest and in transit), policy enforcement engines (e.g., Kubernetes network policies), and automated monitoring tools. These features emphasize seamless integration and dynamic adaptability, enabled through service meshes like Istio. Practical applications include large-scale enterprise data migration, with impacts such as reducing security gaps and improving the efficiency of automated governance.

Implementation steps involve: first, developing centralized security policies; deploying data protection tools (e.g., Vault for secrets management); integrating monitoring systems (e.g., Prometheus); and regularly auditing policy compliance. Typical scenarios include hybrid cloud operations in the financial industry; business values include reducing data breach risks by 40%, ensuring global compliance, and driving IT resilience.
